paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The estimated lifetime risk of MBC in BRCA2 PV carriers is about 4%, more than 40-fold higher than the risk of 0.1% reported in the general male population.
Notably, male BRCA2 PVs carriers are significantly more likely to develop cancer, particularly BC.

functional_data.summary: BRCA2 is involved in maintaining genome integrity and is critical for homologous recombination.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families with multiple cases of breast cancer.
variants.population_frequency: c.5964delT is prevalent in Icelandic populations.
variants.additional_notes: BRCA2 PVs are the strongest genetic risk factor for MBC.
key_quotes: Inherited PVs in BRCA2 are the strongest genetic risk factor for MBC.
Overall, in high-risk families, or in populations in which a founder effect was observed, PVs in the BRCA2 gene are estimated to be responsible for 60–76% of MBCs.

tables_processed.table_caption: Summary of BRCA2 variants and their clinical significance.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
